sourceMeaningMnemonic: When you see <radical>flowers</radical> in a <radical>rice paddy</radical> you can't help but use your <radical>fingers</radical> to <kanji>draw</kanji> them. Have you ever seen rice paddy flowers? They're beautiful. And if you can draw them you can capture that beauty and show it to everyone.
meaningInfo: Imagine using your fingers to draw these rice paddy flowers. Don't worry about how well you can draw, this is so beautiful, anyone could capture it.
readingMnemonic: Even though you tried to <kanji>draw</kanji> the flowers as best you could, whenever someone looks at it they smell <reading>B.O.</reading> (<ja>びょう</ja>). Maybe it's because you were drawing for a really long time and kept sweating. Maybe it's because you are just a stinky person. But no one wants to look at your drawing for long because all they can smell is B.O.
readingInfo: To be fair, would you want to look at a drawing that makes you constantly smell stinky B.O.? I didn't think so.
